CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 25, 1949, pg. 4 reads: "Bashful Bartender - Modesty on the part of Bartender Carlysle Gibson, 733 Filbert Street, whom Floyd V. Murray, Gilbert Wysong and Henry Despert on the left said charged them 75 cents for local beer and 20 cents for Coke at the Rosedal Tavern on June 4, can be seen in this photo as Gibson lowers his eyes and hides behind lamp on magistrate's desk as photographer Teenie Harris snapped this photo. Except for three sentences uttered by the modest mixologist, Atty. Reuben Finegold, far right, did all of the talking for the defense."
TitMainTitle: Gilbert Wysong and Henry Despert, accusing Rosedal Tavern bartender Carlysle Gibson, behind lamp, of overcharging, and his Atty. Reuben Finegold, standing behind counter in Alderman Harry B. Fitzgerald's office
